content: **this is a pay what you want pattern use the code seasons50 for 50% off the original price or use the code seasons100 for a free copy if you download for free i d love it if you gave this pattern a ❤️ thank you for your support the *changing seasons coaster* is a quick beginner-friendly project that s as fun to make as it is to use designed with simplicity in mind it works up fast perfect for a last-minute gift a relaxing evening project or a satisfying stash-buster what makes this coaster special is its decorative flair a playful design at the center finished with an extravagant eye-catching border that instantly elevates the look cute practical and endlessly customizable with color choices this little piece is the perfect way to add handmade charm to your table through every season this pattern is worked with dk/worsted weight yarn and a 4 5 mm hook for coasters i recommend using a synthetic or plant-based fiber these tend to be more durable and easier to wash making them perfect for everyday use the design is worked in the round with simple double_crochet and chain stitches creating an easy enjoyable rhythm as you go it s finished with a decorative lace border that combines shell and picot variations for an extra touch of charm the pattern is written in one standard size which fits most mugs comfortably if you d like a larger or smaller coaster you can easily adjust by changing your hook size experimenting with different yarn weights or adding a round or two this is a beginner-friendly project that relies on simple stitches and approachable techniques to support you along the way you ll also find a step-by-step photo tutorial at the end of the pattern plus links to video demonstrations for all special stitches thank you for choosing my pattern i hope you enjoyed it if you enjoyed this pattern you may be interested in some of my other patterns you can check them out here 1 you may sell as many of the finished items as you wish but if you share on social media please give me credit @elly donner on ravelry and link the pattern to its source if you have any questions or need pattern support please contact me here 2 @stopitharry on ravelry i appreciate your support thank you to my amazing testers divavonpurl /people/divavonpurl jstockert /people/jstockert kaikelasa /people/kaikelasa jooleej /people/jooleej bellaseesstars /people/bellaseesstars kerrydemps /people/kerrydemps yarnseed /people/yarnseed coffeebuddy /people/coffeebuddy katisha /people/katisha batty4yarn /people/batty4yarn minnepurle /people/minnepurle ciscavm /people/ciscavm esme9812 /people/esme9812 sharonluvs2knit2 /people/sharonluvs2knit2 beckymerr /people/beckymerr maylina /people/maylina & czerwonykapturek /people/czerwonykapturek this pattern
